decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a combination of disruptive spells and powerful card draw to control the game and outvalue opponents. By leveraging cards like Force of Will, Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while using Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise to draw into more resources and answers, the deck aims to navigate the game towards victory. With a versatile suite of spells and strong mana base, this deck is designed to outmaneuver opponents and secure the win through careful decision-making and resource management.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells and creatures to control the game, while also using card advantage through draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, removal like Fatal Push, and hand disruption like Thoughtseize. The deck also includes creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and out-value the opponent through efficient plays and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria slow down the opponent, while Chancellor of the Annex and Seasoned Dungeoneer provide card advantage. Powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen accelerate the deck, and disruptive cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Void Mirror further hinder the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Strip Mine to deal with problematic creatures or lands.

This deck is focused on combining fast mana acceleration with disruptive artifacts to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing powerful artifact creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler alongside established Vintage staples like Mishra's Workshop and Mana Crypt, this deck aims to lock down the board and pressure the opponent into submission. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere further disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and control options. Overall, this deck seeks to capitalize on its synergy between aggressive creatures and artifact-based disruption to win the game swiftly and decisively.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and control over the board. It utilizes powerful counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Fatal Push to control the battlefield. The inclusion of card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time ensures that the player always has options available. Additionally, the deck uses efficient creatures like Psychic Frog to apply pressure and keep the opponent on their toes, ultimately leading to a victory through attrition and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures and utilizing graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap, aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to quickly stock the graveyard, along with powerful dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck aims to constantly bring back creatures to create a never-ending stream of threats. With the ability to disrupt opponents with Force of Will and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to win before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful control elements, card advantage, and efficient removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a late-game win condition. By leveraging cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Gifts Ungiven, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and out-value the opponent. Cards like Time Walk, Time Vault, and Yawgmoth's Will provide additional win conditions and ways to generate advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring value and flexibility in adapting to different game states.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and Moxen, the deck aims to put powerful threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler onto the battlefield quickly. The deck also includes key cards like Trinisphere and Manifold Key to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own resources. Overall, the deck seeks to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game to secure a decisive victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and controlling the game tempo. It utilizes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to stop key plays, along with tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find essential cards. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Sensei's Divining Top to maintain hand advantage. With cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Bolas's Citadel, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on generating massive card advantage and mana through utilizing artifacts and spells such as Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to quickly cycle through the deck, generate enough mana to cast powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, and ultimately win the game through a combination of card advantage and overwhelming board presence. The deck is designed to be efficient and consistent, able to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies with counterspells like Force of Will.

This deck focuses on utilizing the "Coveted Jewel" card to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage, allowing for explosive plays and combos. By ramping up quickly with artifact mana accelerants like Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to set up game-winning plays. The inclusion of powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and flexibility to ensure victory. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Bazaar of Baghdad card to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One, allowing for explosive aggro plays early in the game. With a combination of powerful creatures, disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with graveyard recursion cards like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Master of Death, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells to control the game, while also using disruptive creatures and artifacts to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently trading resources and disrupting their strategy, ultimately pulling ahead and securing victory through card advantage and superior board control.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Time Vault, Black Lotus, and Moxen to ramp up quickly, while also employing cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Grim Monolith to create a threatening board state. The deck also includes disruption elements like Trinisphere and Pithing Needle to hinder the opponent's game plan, giving it a proactive and disruptive strategy to win games through early aggression and powerful artifact synergy.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Doomsday, Thassa's Oracle, and various card draw and manipulation spells. The goal is to cast Doomsday to set up a winning stack of cards, then either draw into Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot or protect the combo using countermagic. The deck also includes other powerful cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Black Lotus to help find and protect the combo. The key strategy is to carefully plan and execute the Doomsday pile while keeping the opponent's disruption in mind.

This deck focuses on using Doomsday as its primary win condition, utilizing cards like Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation to quickly combo off and win the game. The deck is packed with cantrips and card draw to dig through the deck efficiently, while also having several counterspells and disruption to protect the combo. With a few key pieces like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall to accelerate the game, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to achieve victory before the opponent can establish their own game plan.
